main event: Visual observation of a bright object moving in a level, straight course at about 1000 ft over the Pacific.
interesting points: The object was seen moving west without any deviation for about 15 minutes., The object was described as round, the size of a pinhead, and bright as the first magnitude star., Observers used ground visual binoculars for the sighting., The sighting was reported at night with clear to partly cloudy weather conditions., There is a possibility that the radar detection was a reflection from a balloon.
witness description: D J Krejacarced (LCDR USN), T H Wood (LT USN), K W McKenney (ENS USN)
